title: Why did organized crime spread so quickly in the 1920s? - Quora

response.answer_text: It was due because of prohibition which made it criminal to drink alcohol. the best thing was is that ordinary, otherwise law abiding people wanted the supply of booze and they had no problem in buying it. the cops looked the other way as well, alcohol is the bane of our existence and all prohibition did was prove unpopular laws are difficult to enforce and made gangsters rich.
